Package tmanagerproj

Class TaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • tmanagerproj.TaskManager
  • public class TaskManager
extends java.lang.Object

    TaskManager

        Is a command line program used to quickly create a personal todo or deadline task list. It will first initialize by loading a full list of previously saved tasks, read in from a default work file "/data/data.txt", into an in-memory Tasks ArrayList, newly created for the user when the program starts, and will continue to accept new user inputs from then on. It parses and validates user inputs to store new tasks into the ArrayList, updates the done status of tasks, delete tasks, resets deadlines, archives and removes all Done tasks to file. A mode to do 10-lines pagination of the entire Tasks list is also available.

        In addition, commands options exist that can show a Tasks list under a Main Menu, a Todo subMenu, a Deadline subMenu or a Done task subMenu, with an accompanying suite of specifically crafted commands that ensure the continued proper command syntax and contextual use, under each specific view - for the convenience of users; all possible errors caused by user command mix-ups will be detected and nullified via real-time verification and validation at runtime, to ensure error-free and non-corruption compliance throughout program use at all times.

        Emergencies situations have also been catered for - in the form of immediate user prompts given the user - once the original default ones are no longer available for some technical reasons: to get the user to specify both the work file and backup file paths for that emergency session setup only. It is expected user will arrange for everything correctly so that all the files will be created successfully. After the emergency session has ended, measures should be taken to restore the application proper, or the Administrator should be contacted to restore the TaskManager program to its pristine state before the program's next run.

    Since:
    2018-08-28
    Version:
    Level 12
    Author:
    Gwee Yeu Chai

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskManager

        protected TaskManager​(java.lang.String filePath)
        The TaskManager constructor reads in the default database text file, create an Ui Object ui , a Storage Object storage and a TaskList Object tasks. If file read is unsuccessful, programmed emergency measures will activate next, and a live user session can still go online for the User to work from, starting out with a provided empty Task List instead.
        Parameters:
        filePath - database file's path.
        See Also:
        TaskManagerException

      • updateTask

        private void updateTask​(java.lang.String line)
                 throws TaskManagerException
        This optimized method updates the task done status in tasks List, freshens up the database work file data format: ensures format integrity and data currency at the same time.
        Parameters:
        line - takes in the scanned text string from user input.
        Throws:
        TaskManagerException - on missing task number that should follow the CLI "done" command.

        Throws:

      • menuType

        private void menuType​(boolean main,
                      boolean todo,
                      boolean deadline,
                      boolean done)
        This method will track which Menu View the user is currently using or under
        Parameters:
        main - the boolean value for the Main menu view
        todo - the boolean value for the Todo menu view
        deadline - the boolean value for the Deadline menu view
        done - the boolean value for the Done menu view

      • run

        private void run()
        This method starts the main TaskManager Program with a Welcome Screen with the Commands Legend Menu, activates the right operations as per the valid commands parsed and passed. Upon exit, a Bye screen will be displayed. The entire Tasks List is flushed to disk and secured on a default backup file. All used resources are closed.

      • updateEntree

        private void updateEntree​(java.lang.String line,
                          java.lang.String s)
                   throws TaskManagerException
        This is a helper method to allow update to the task Done status of a task when under a Todo SubMenu or Deadline. SubMenu View.
        Parameters:
        line - Stores the User input of CLI command and the task number.
        s - contains the total number of Todo, Deadline or Done tasks in tasks List.
        Throws:
        TaskManagerException - on missing task description (after the command's first word)

      • showDoneTasks

        private void showDoneTasks​(TaskList tasks)
        This method displays all the numbered Done tasks under a Done SubMenu View.
        Parameters:
        tasks - in-memory tasks List object.

      • archiveDoneTasks

        private void archiveDoneTasks​(TaskList tasks)
        This method is a housekeeping function that archives and removes all Done Tasks from the tasks List and writes to disk: to the default backup file set by Admin.
        Parameters:
        tasks - the in-memory tasks List object.

        Parameters:
        line - contains the User input of CLI command and the task number.
        Throws:
        TaskManagerException - on missing task description (after the command's first word)

        Parameters:
        line - Stores the User input of CLI command and the number of the task.
        Throws:
        TaskManagerException - on missing Todo Task description.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - on User text input instead of a task number.
